abstracts.cdata!:
The project consists of studies to
            assist the Government in (i) the preparation of water supply
            master plans for the two largest urban agglomerations, Adem
            and Mukalla; (ii) the assessment of potential water
            resources in other populated areas of the country; and (iii)
            the elaboration of the first construction phase of projects
            for the improvement and expansion of water supply services
            in the areas under consideration. The project also includes
            technical assistance to the Government for the formulation
            of appropriate administrative structures and financial
            policies for the national water authority, the Public Water
            Corporation (PWC), a comprehensive tariff study, and the
            procurement of equipment and materials required for the
            studies. A total of 140 man-months ($7,700 per man-month) of
            consulting services is required. The project presents no
            special risks.
